sentences.sContent: We don’t allow diving in the pool.
...our test driver believed the bus was going to slow or stop to allow us to merge into the traffic...
...One should enter it vaguely, and allow what is there freely to attract and influence the eye to walk the rounds of the bookshops...
...Agreeable people boost your confidence and allow you to relax and feel comfortable...
...The objective of this debating game is not to win but to get to the truth that will allow you to move faster...
...Internet providers allow instant viewing of almost any movie or television　program ever created...
...our brain evolved circuits to allow us to experience sympathy...
...responsibilities and expectations to all candidates and allow them to make an informed decision...
...Both of these radio forms allow listeners to tune in stations that are more distant than the local stations they could receive in the past...
...digital recording devices allow audience members more control over which commercials they watch...

remMethod.val: al(表加强) ＋ low(低) → 低头承认 → 点头同意 → 允许

words.tran: 许可的；正当的；可承认的；可获宽免

trans.tranOther: to let someone do or have something, or let something happen
